text: we've all had those nights where we wake
up in the middle of the night and we
can't get back to sleep and it's
actually a very isolating lonely feeling
we've all had periods of stress we'll
induce it or sometimes just you wake up
and there's no stimulation there's no
one around there's no one to talk to
some folks jump on the internet and
start searching things but unfortunately
that's going to stimulate that's going
to wake you up the light from your
computer's going into your eyes your
brain thinks you're now supposed to be
awake and so it really is not going to
help you to relax to fall back to sleep
some people use breathing techniques so
if you are in that state where you're
awake and you're laying in bed and you
don't know what to do a good technique
that I learned from a psychologist who
does hypnotherapy is to do some deep
breathing breathing in through your nose
out through your mouth on a rhythmic
deep level and even sort of chanting
inside of your mind relax as you breathe
out and allow your parasympathetic
nervous system your autonomic nervous
system to release some hormones that
will help you to relax and fall back to
sleep but I would resist the temptation
to jump onto your computer or put the
light on because you're just going to
keep yourself up
